column1: JOB SUMMARY
The Digital Investment Associate is a key member of the Digital Investment team of experts responsible for delivering smart
column2: innovative and performance driven Digital campaigns for its clients. They take the lead in identifying and selecting media partners that achieve identified strategic and tactical objectives as laid out by the Connections Planning and Comms Planning teams. They are the primary owners of the vendor relationships and are responsible for all negotiation and value creation with these vendors and for ensuring each plan is executed with excellence. They supply aggregated quantitative and qualitative information for group level reporting for rate and program negotiations. The team is expected to stay at the cutting edge of Digital innovation within the industry and educate the larger brand/client teams on relevant opportunities and challenges.

column1: In order to fulfil these requirements
column2: the Digital Investment team must collaborate seamlessly with other functional teams and specialties. This role reports to the Digital Investment Buyer and will support the larger Digital Investment team.

column1: MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist Buyer with the preparation and submission of RFPs (Request For Proposal) to prospective site partners.
Collate site partner responses for team review and participate in assessment of responses with team.
Assist with providing supporting content for recommended partners and programs to the Connection Planning team for plan recommendation to client.
Contribute to client status report on behalf of Digital Investment team.
Prepare and issue insertion orders through Prisma system after Connections Planning team provides client authorization; Update as necessary.
Assists in creation of plan detail and spec sheet to creative team and/or brand for trafficking.
Partner with ad ops team to ensure go live readiness.
Reporting/Tracking
Assist in documenting all rate and added value detail by vendor for use in future negotiation.
Assist in compiling campaign performance data into reports to help the team optimize plans to best performing partners and placements.
Assist in providing Connection Planning team regular reporting documents to provide back to client.
Partner with Connection Planning team to ensure up to date investment tracking for monthly reporting.
Vendor Partnerships & Industry
Meet with vendor sales representatives to obtain information about their products.
Coordinate vendor connections including: sit-down meetings

Department ProfileThe cornerstone of Morgan Stanley's risk management philosophy is the execution of risk-adjusted returns through prudent risk-taking that protects Morgan Stanley's capital base and franchise. Risk Management protects the Firm from exposure to losses resulting from defaults by our lending and trading counterparties. Credit Risk Management (CRM) evaluates credit risk transactions and approves rejects or modifies them considering the availability and appropriateness of arrangements for reducing risk or risk mitigation. The department also assigns Internal Credit Ratings; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions.Primary ResponsibilitiesThis role is within the Funds coverage team in New York
column2: which is responsible for the credit assessment and risk management of the Firm’s business with leveraged and non-leveraged funds
column3: and provides product coverage for Morgan Stanley’s Prime Brokerage business as well as bilateral OTC
column4: cleared and exchange traded client activity. The NY Funds team is comprised of 12 staff members located in New York
column5: with additional coverage in Budapest and Mumbai.

column1: The Associate Banker role is an integral part of the sales organization of Citi Private Bank. The Associate Banker assists the Private Bankers to develop and deepen client relationships in order to thoroughly understand the client situation and utilize that knowledge to develop tailored wealth management strategies. The role is a pipeline to becoming a Private Banker.
The Associate Banker is responsible for three main activities: 1) New Client & Business Development; 2) Sales Support / Relationship Management and 3) Compliance and Controls.
1) New Client & Business Development
Assist the Banker in the creation of sales and marketing strategies designed to generate revenue growth
Prospecting - conduct new client / prospect research

column3: and converting prospects into CPB clients

column3: and maintain all client call records including call reports

column1: 2) Sales Support / Relationship Management

column3: and implementing a wealth management strategy designed to deepen relationships with existing clients

column1: Provide accurate and timely revenue tracking and deal pipeline reports and other relevant information to the Banker
Maintain appropriate levels of contact with clients to assist the Banker in revising the strategy based on clients' needs and changes in the markets
Handle complex client inquiries and resolve issues unrelated to service and account opening
3) Compliance and Controls
Investment Objective Setting (IOS) - collect and confirm from Bankers the client's investment objectives setting and risk tolerance. Assist with annual attestation process and suitability reviews
Liaise with Client Account Officers to ensure all appropriate KYC and other aspects of client records and documentation are completed and updated
